article.title: The_Triumph_of_Time
article.paragraph: no footnotesJanuary 2013"The Triumph of Time" is a poem byAlgernon Charles Swinburne, published in 1866. It is in adaptedottava rimaand is full of elaborate use of literary devices, particularlyalliteration. The theme, which purports to be autobiographical, is that of rejected love. The (male) speaker deplores the ruin of his life, and in tones at times reminiscent ofHamlet, craves oblivion, for which the sea serves as a constant metaphor.
